title: Biden urges unity to stem racial hate after Buffalo shooting - The Associated Press - en Español
content:
1. Biden urges unity to stem racial hate after Buffalo shooting  The Associated Press - en Español
  2. Mass shooting at Buffalo supermarket was a racist hate crime, police say  CNN
  3. Buffalo shooting suspect Payton Gendron's parents interviewed by feds day after supermarket attack: Officials  Fox News
  4. Payton Gendron wore hazmat suit to school, was hospitalized after threatening classmates  New York Post
  5. The extreme-right theory helped trigger the Buffalo NY tragedy  NorthJersey.com
  6. View Full Coverage on Google News
description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden urged unity Sunday to address the “hate that remains a stain on the soul of America” after a deadly mass shooting at a supermarket in Buffalo, New York, while state officials pleaded for federal action to end the ”uniquely American phenomenon” of mass shootings.
